open market.translation[0].definitions[0: a system which makes it easy to buy and sell goods with other countries, because there are few restrictions
There is now an open market within the European Community.
open market.translation[1].definitions[0: a market where foreign competitors are allowed
The main aim of the World Trade Organisation is to promote open markets worldwide.
open market.translation[2].definitions[0: in an open-market action, operation etc, a CENTRAL BANK increases or reduces the MONEY SUPPLY (=the amount of money in the economy)
a Federal Reserve open-market operation that injected $1 billion of cash into the banking system
